attributes.action: Remove disability exemptions for the armed forces from the 2010 Equality Act
attributes.background: I was recently rejected by the Lancaster UOTC because of my Autism even though during their selection day in Liverpool I passed all their selection tests and completed all the required paperwork. They rejected me because I declared that I had a medical condition (Autism)
attributes.additional_details:
They rejected me because I declared on one of the medical forms that I have a medical condition (Autism). I had to declare it as it was a legal requirement. 
 
https://apply.army.mod.uk/how-to-join/can-i-join/medical
 
Autism is not included, yet on other British Army medical forms, one must disclose their Autism, and in turn they can be discriminated against because of this due to the exemption from parts of the Equality Act 2010.

attributes.action: Include education on domestic abuse to the national curriculum.
attributes.background: I am a survivor of domestic abuse and violence which resulted in me losing my children. I think all children should be educated about domestic abuse so that they can identify it and so that they know it’s not acceptable.
attributes.additional_details: My experiences led me to write my experiences down and I’m waiting for a book to emerge be published. I’ve also set up a Facebook page called Parent Alienation Syndrome to help others in my situation.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for all adults working with children to be first aid trained.
attributes.background: Not all members of preschool/school staff are first aid trained only a select few. Trained adults can be absent from work or out on a course or a school trip and leave the school without a first aider. This is a particular issue at lunchtimes in school when the adult ratio to children is often low.
attributes.additional_details: Children can have many complex medical needs/ food allergies. As well as everyday trips and bumps in the playground. Unfortunately acciends have been reported in the news and a recent case of a boy choking at lunchtime. All staff should be trained to avoid being left without a first aider for our children when they need one. All adults working with children should know what to do.

attributes.action: Better treatment for NHS dialysis patients
attributes.background:
Government figures. I If a patient enters dialysis after the age of 
70to 75 life expectancy is 1 to 2 years. I entered at the age of 82 I am now in my 7th year.
attributes.additional_details:
Kidney failure
This petition could apply to any person of any age. 
I never had kidney failure, I had two operations 12 years apart each operation killed one kidney. 	 
I diagnosed myself and informed the doctor in writing more than a dozen times when I had a closure of an artery,  
There is a system for detecting closures it’s called a transonic flow meter it is used on patients once every three months? 
My petition is for the flow meter to be used on the patient four times a month with a minimum of twice a month.
It will mean patients living longer but that is what nursing is all about? 
Please sign this petition, you will be helping others and by unfortunate chance you might be helping your self.

attributes.action: Introduce free flu jabs for people using Lithium Carbonate for Bipolar disorder
attributes.background: Lithium Carbonate is considered to be the gold standard for controlling the symptoms of bipolar disorder, however, the symptoms of flu including diarrhoea, vomiting, dehydration and fever are exactly those which can cause Lithium toxicity which can quickly become fatal.
attributes.additional_details: By providing flu vaccinations, the government will be taking a pre-emptive step, reducing the risk of lithium toxicity while, at the same time, reducing the number of hospital beds taken up and allowing treatment of flu victims who require it.

attributes.action: Safeguard School Milk Funding Post-Brexit
attributes.background: With funding for the EU School Milk Scheme under consideration, and the Nursery Milk Scheme being consulted on, millions of children may be at risk of missing out on milk that generations before them received. We're calling on the Government to commit to funding a replacement scheme post-Brexit

attributes.action: Fund a National Holodomor Memorial
attributes.background: The Holodomor was a famine that occurred in the years 1932-33 in what is now Ukraine. It is recognised as genocide or as a criminal act of the Stalinist Regime by 22 countries. While the undersigned support the government's decision not to join these countries, we believe it deserves recognition.
attributes.additional_details: The government has chosen (quite rightly) to construct a memorial to the Holocaust. We believe that the Holodomor was horrific enough to merit this same recognition. A memorial to those who died in the Holodomor (some 7.5 million people, according to some estimates) would serve as a message that the UK truly rejects this kind of evil in whatever form it takes, whether blatant or less conspicuous and whether from the left or the right of the political spectrum.

attributes.action: Ensure school curriculum includes educating students on crime and consequences
attributes.background: Crime at young ages affects everyone in the community. It affects the offender as they should be learning and that is postponed or permanently stopped. It would affect the victim as it would affect any victim mentally. It will also affect the community as a whole, making the area look atrocious.

attributes.action: Abandon government plans to include calories on all restaurant menus
attributes.background: The government’s plan to list calories on all restaurant menus not only will remove the joy of eating out at restaurants, but also is a cruel hinderance to those recovering from eating disorders. We need a more nuanced way to define what is “healthy” than obsessively listing and tracking calories.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.telegraph.co.uk/politics/2018/09/04/plans-force-restaurants-cafes-takeaways-display-calorie-counts/

attributes.action: all children to attend the school nearest to their home address
attributes.background: Remove parental choice of school - You only have to travel in commuter time in school holidays vs other dates to know how much congestion and pollution,and  along with wasted man hours and traffic collisions are caused by children having to commute to their parents' chosen schools.
attributes.additional_details:
What a waste of time and valuable growing up, as well as the safety risks.

Parents would be better off spending their time energy and money on helping to improve their local school rather than selfishly encouraging their children to attend 'better' ones further away.

attributes.action: Make Senior and 16-25 Railcards follow the same Time & Fare restrictions
attributes.background: The 16-25 Railcard is the same cost and appears to be the same as the Senior Railcard (for over 60's). However, the 16-25 card has a list of restrictions that do not apply to the senior card, including a minimum fare and time restrictions. Why are there not the same allowances?
attributes.additional_details: Apprentices, students & the young in work for the most, have to be up early for Uni/Work etc. and are notoriously hard up, at the start of there careers/working bottom end jobs. However while commuting to work as an apprentice, seeing a senior citizen go from there new range rover to the train, then be receiving a vastly discounted fare for the same journey does not seem fair. There are 2 sides as there are less well off elderly, and youth with money, however why give to one and not the other?

attributes.action: Create a governing body to regulate private landlords to protect tenants
attributes.background: Too many private landlords do not carry out their legal obligations at the detriment of their tenants. A governing body is required to regulate such requirements and support tenants whom need to report such landlords for not meeting safety & obligatory maintenance and to investigate harrassment
attributes.additional_details: If you have been subjected to unsafe living conditions, patronising responses, lack of communication and no action taken on much needed property repairs and/or maintenance, then a regulating body is required to fully investigate in depth. Local authorities currently do not have enough capacity to assist with such needs across the UK.

attributes.action: Require phone providers to stop charging for handsets on expiration of contract
attributes.background: The government should make it law that mobile phone providers should be obliged to make sure that any customers staying in a contract past the end of a fixed deal have their monthly bill reduced to reflect the cost of the handset.
attributes.additional_details:
In October 2017 Citizens Advice found that three of the four largest mobile phone providers – Vodafone, EE and Three – continued to charge customers extra for a handset after it had been paid off as part of their fixed deal.  The majority of people who are caught out by this are the over 65s.

https://www.citizensadvice.org.uk/about-us/how-citizens-advice-works/media/press-releases/mobile-phone-networks-overcharging-loyal-customers-by-up-to-38-a-month/

attributes.action: Ban the use of full names in GP or hospital waiting rooms
attributes.background: Confidentiality is up most important in settings such as GP surgeries and hospitals. Data protection laws are tougher now than ever. However they don’t seem to apply when in a waiting room, the professional will call you through by using your full name in front of other people.
attributes.additional_details: I am starting this petition after a prisoner attached to their guard in a waiting room was called through for his appointment. All it took was for me to google their name and gather information as to why they were in prison, how long their sentence was and their address. People’s identities should be protected in GP and hospital waiting rooms.

attributes.action: Ban night shift working, for the sake of the health of workers
attributes.background: Studies have established that the health of workers in the UK is directly negatively affected by night shift working. I ask Parliament to hold a debate over this practice. Why are hard-working people being made to suffer unnecessarily, and why does the Health and Safety at Work Act not protect them?
attributes.additional_details: Long-term night shift work is associated with an increased risk of certain cancers, as well as metabolic problems, heart disease, ulcers and gastrointestinal problems. People who work night shifts or rotating shifts often don't sleep enough. Long-term sleep deprivation is known to be bad for health. Statistics show that a large amount of UK workers are shift workers and, in particular, night shift workers.

attributes.action: Dual the entire route of the A47
attributes.background: Tens of thousands of vehicles use the A47 every year. It is one of the most important roads in the UK more specifically the East of England. The route is also used by numerous logistics companies. However there are also hundreds of accidents every   causing confusion and delay.

attributes.action: Require unused holiday pay to be paid to employees at end of every year service.
attributes.background: Many employees lose out of their full holiday pay mostly due to unable to take them depending on their job role. Employers are entitled to 5.6 weeks holiday a year. Sometimes requests get rejected by employers or can't use them all. All unused holiday play should be paid at end of the holiday year.
attributes.additional_details: I've requested holidays to be used in quiet periods and most the time I don't get them and end up losing atleast half my holiday pay aswell as many others. What's the point in entitling employees 5.6 weeks a year but they don't get the full holidays they are entitled to. These unused holidays should be paid to employees at the end of every working year as its unfair if the employer does not usage them and in turn we lose out on what we are entitled to every year.  Scrap the "don't use you lose"

attributes.action: Stop the Lifetime ISA & allow customers to withdraw their money with no penalty
attributes.background: Lifetime Isas allow adults under 40 to save for their first home or pension in one pot with a 25 per cent bonus from the Government. They were revealed in the 2016 budget and launched in April 2017. However, many are being caught out by the strict withdrawal rules.

attributes.action: Outlaw councils from banning dogs from public beaches in England and Wales.
attributes.background: Most dog owners pick up their dog waste and control their  dogs. People work all week or all even year for those magic moments on a beach with their family and dog, only to find dogs are not allowed on many beaches in England and Wales.
attributes.additional_details: More litter/dog wardens could be employed giving offenders high on the spot fines.

attributes.action: Change the level of proof for suicide verdicts to "on balance of probabilities"
attributes.background: Reaching a verdict of suicide demands the case must be made ‘beyond reasonable doubt’, the criminal standard of proof. This skews the figures hiding hundreds more suicides. If the level of proof were changed, there would be greater urgency to fund mental health services for young people.
attributes.additional_details: In 2015 there were 6,639 suicides in the UK and Republic of Ireland, but we still believe that there were more that weren't recorded. Half of the people with mental health problems as adults present with symptoms by the age of 14. But only 8% of mental health funding goes to services for children and young people. If these numbers were highlighted we believe that more could be done to alleviate the problems and reduce the risk of someone taking their own life, and not looked upon as a sin.

attributes.action: Government funding for free public transport for stage 4 cancer patients.
attributes.background:
There should be free public transport for people under pension age who have stage 4 cancer, or similarly life-shortening illnesses.
This entitlement will end at pension age to be replaced by the freedom pass.
attributes.additional_details: Those diagnosed with life-shortening illnesses will not have the opportunity to use free public transport for as long as the rest of the public on average.

attributes.action: Make the history of British colonialism part of high school curriculum.
attributes.background: Too many people, especially the new generation do not know anything about the British empire or the colonies which helped make Britain great. Some people are also oblivious to the pain and suffering the Empire caused as well as all the positive impacts it had to less affluent countries.
attributes.additional_details: Britain is a huge multicultural society. Our society, whatever their background need to be taught where they came from and how they got to the positions they are in now. It’s a too wider misconception that there has just been constant mass migrations for no apparent reason. I believe if the history of the British Empire were taught then a lot of what is happening in the present would be sympathised with and more could be done to resolve issues by all ethnicities.

attributes.action: Ban the selling and open displaying of Golliwog dolls in UK stores.
attributes.background: Golliwog dolls depict a racially insulting charactater of black people. This is no longer acceptable. Sign the petition and let the goverment know, how the UK really feels about the legal selling and displaying of Golliwog dolls.
attributes.additional_details:
The Golliwog character has long been used in childrens literature, to denigrate black people. The use of the racial word "wog" originates from this ignorant depiction of black people.

It's time for all people to make clear that the selling of these racially provocative dolls, needs to stop.

The displaying of such dolls on store front windows, has to stop.

Share and sign this petition.

attributes.action: Undertake an independent enquiry into the role of Russia in Brexit.
attributes.background: 30+ individuals have been charged by Special Counsel Mueller in his continuing investigation of Russian interference in the US presidential election. I feel that there is sufficient evidence that a parallel investigation into Russian interference on Brexit is warranted.
attributes.additional_details: Individuals charged or convicted under the Mueller enquiry are known to have met with key Brexit figures during the Brexit / US election campaigns, as well having contact with Wikileaks. Prominent pro-Brexit figures are also alleged to have met directly with representatives of Wikileaks and repeatedly visited the Russian embassy in London.

attributes.action: Mandatory minimum life sentence for rape
attributes.background: In 2003 its estimated there were 50,000 rapes every year. 600 sent to jail on average. If this isn’t ridiculous then.. There will be no change if we don’t start by helping the people in the world. Victims have a life sentence, so should the perpetrators.
attributes.additional_details: Raping someone is as bad as killing someone, because no one recovers from that. There is not enough justice for victims. Rapists do time and then are back out in the world to do it again. This needs to change and this is a start.

attributes.action: Give Northern Ireland a vote on whether to accept the backstop
attributes.background: Leaving the EU is a change in constitutional status, and the people of Northern Ireland are being denied their rights to vote on whether they support that change for themselves or whether they vote for their own specific backstop.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/the-belfast-agreement

attributes.action: Now facts are known, allow the public to vote between no deal or remaining in EU
attributes.background: The government can not agree on a brexit agreement with the EU, and now full facts on what a No deal brexit means, the public should be allowed to make an informed vote on remaining in the EU or having a no deal Brexit

attributes.action: Change law so a caring original owner can reclaim their dog
attributes.background: I was made homeless 4 years ago and was placed in bed and breakfast so I couldn’t take my dog with me. We had him two years from a puppy. So I found a friend who was willing to look after him till I got my home. I was paying for my boys expenses and food only for him to sell him.
attributes.additional_details: The police told me that he was looked after and being fed there’s nothing I could do. Last week I saw a video of my boy at the local kennels immediately made contact. I told them I’m going to do whatever it take to bring him home, They let me go see him. They told me yes he’s my dog he’s in my name still. But he’s been there over 7 days so he’s no longer mine. He’s not allowed home and he’s got a new family. The law should allow people like me to reclaim their pets.

attributes.action: Increase the minimum annual leave entitlement from 5.6 weeks to 7.6 weeks.
attributes.background:
The increasing retirement age leaves far less to look forward to at the end of our working lives. We are asking for increased minimum annual leave entitlements during our working lives to compensate for this loss.

This will give us more time with our families and to follow our own interests.
attributes.additional_details:
Retirement age is increasing (currently 67). Estimates are that when today's teenagers retire, the retirement age will be 75. People currently look forward to retirement but with increasing age there are fewer possibilities for those years.

Give us extra leave during our working years so that we can feel that we have lives and interests beyond work. It will reduce stress and exhaustion as well as increase happiness.

We will benefit, our children will benefit, our employers will benefit.

attributes.action: Give leave to remain to Commonwealth Citizens and HM Forces service personnel
attributes.background: Give all commonwealth citizens and HM Forces service personnel the indefinite right to live in the UK. We owe an allegiance to the United Kingdom and Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth the Second regardless of our nationality.
attributes.additional_details: Regular or Reserve, Serving or Ex-Service personnel should be protected, especially citizens of the Commonwealth serving in HM Forces. Parliament should pass a law that protect all service members of all branches of the British Forces, regular and reserve. We're not just a number.

attributes.action: Change minimum legal age of marriage in England and Wales to 18
attributes.background:
It's actually so ridiculous that 16 year olds can get married at age 16 with parental permission. 
Just don't think it's right.
attributes.additional_details: What did you do when you were 16 that you regret? Hopefully nothing that legally bound you!

attributes.action: All asylum seekers crossing the Channel be given the right to live in the UK
attributes.background: The UK has a proud history of tolerance, compassion and respect for human rights. Action must be taken to prevent a potential tragedy in the Channel. If asylum seekers are returned to France or elsewhere, they will simply try again to get to the UK. The problem will escalate unless stopped.
attributes.additional_details: If refugees attempt to cross the Channel by dinghy to get to the UK, then they should be intercepted, brought safely to the UK shore and automatically granted the right to live in the UK on humanitarian grounds. Once in the UK, all refugees and asylum seekers must be given the right to settle and be treated with dignity and respect. They must have provision to live in the community. There must be no use of immigration detention centres - fleeing war, genocide and persecution is not a crime.

attributes.action: Renumber the A1(M) from Leeds to Newcastle as the M1
attributes.background: As the A1 has now been upgraded to motorway standard from Leeds to Newcastle for the entire length,to the A1(M), it would make more sense to renumber this section as t he M1, to create a continuous M1 motorway from London to Newcastle.
attributes.additional_details: Renumbering the A1(M) to the M1 would be enormously beneficial to the counties of Yorkshire, County Durham and Tyne and Wear.

attributes.action: Urge Bank of England to remove tallow (cow flesh) from new £20 and £50 notes
attributes.background: The new, polymer £20 and £50 note denominations are set to continue using tallow (cow flesh) as a component. This is UNACCEPTABLE to the current 3.5 million vegans, 7 million vegetarians, 817,000 Hindus and many others in the UK who all oppose the slaughter of cows.
attributes.additional_details:
This is over 17% of the UK population!

NUMBER OF VEGANS AND VEGETARIANS IN THE UK:
 
https://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/food-and-drink/vegans-uk-rise-popularity-plant-based-diets-veganism-figures-survey-compare-the-market-a8286471.html
 
(https://www.comparethemarket.com/car-insurance/content/cars-against-humanity/)
 
NUMBER OF HINDUS IN THE UK:
 
https://www.ons.gov.uk/peoplepopulationandcommunity/culturalidentity/religion/articles/religioninenglandandwales2011/2012-12-11

attributes.action: Stop pets being sold online.
attributes.background: This is becoming a huge issue, people buy pets sometimes with bad intentions or purely for breeding therefore aren't buying your pet as a 'pet' to love and care for. This is massively on the increase and unwanted pets should be rehomed through trusted places such as dogs trust rather than eBay etc.
attributes.additional_details: These websites don't specialise in pets or regulations in that industry therefore you never really know what you're getting yourself into selling your pet on these sites. Professional agencies trusted to rehome your pets should be used. dogs are being sold on hundreds of sites for extremely cheap prices with no questions asked by the seller to the buyer regarding whether the requirements will be met for housing needs, food and dietary requirements. We must keep pets safe.

attributes.action: Start safeguarding parents from abusive ex-partners.
attributes.background: I want to safeguard mothers and fathers who have been victims of abuse from and ex partner. We must change the law and guidance to prevent parents from being expected to enter mediation with their abuser.
attributes.additional_details: Many women and men are expected to mediate with abusive ex-partners for the ‘benefit’ of the child whilst no safeguarding is considered for the parent who has to mediate with someone who mentally, physically or sexually assaulted them. Many parents’ well-being is forgotten in these circumstances, and lives can be put at risk if we keep ignoring this.

attributes.action: Raise the practical driving test standards considerably.
attributes.background: By raising the Practical Driving Test Standards we can expect to see only the safest drivers pass and the road fatalities fall. If the standards are raised considerably everyone including young drivers will enjoy a lower insurance premium and safer roads.
attributes.additional_details:
The average cost for a young driver under the age of 25 to obtain an insurance in 2018 is a whopping £1400!

https://www.moneysavingexpert.com/insurance/young-drivers/

Young drivers account for a quarter of road fatalities.

https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/448039/young-car-drivers-2013-data.pdf

attributes.action: Fine for parked car running over 1 minute and let people provide evidence of it.
attributes.background:
My child have born recently I understood there is necessary to do something about unnecessary usage of fuel.
In average city I can't walk a few meters to not smell terrible diesel exhaust. 
So
-no idling the car over 1 minute
-when asked to switch off and ignored video footage could bring a fee.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a new legislation about it but its completely useless to bring somebody to responsibility for this behaviour.
I really don't believe people stop speeding when they could avoid the fine being asked to slow down and obey the request.
Lots of cars make the same pollution(some of the gases) while idling when driving even they use much less fuel. I'm driver and i don't want to stop usage of fuels and cars but save the environment and the wallet when possible to make our place to live better

attributes.action: Make it a UK law for premises selling food or drink to hold EpiPens
attributes.background: Allergies are on the rise in the UK and there are an increasing amount of stories of people who have suffered severely or even died from the unawareness and ignorance surrounding food allergies. Many cases of anaphylaxis could be prevented if epipens were provided by food and drink establishments
attributes.additional_details: There have been many cases where a second EpiPen has been needed to treat an anaphylaxis shock. If food establishments were to hold EpiPens for consumers with allergies they could prevent serious illness and in some cases death. It is understandable that EpiPens can't just be handed out to any member of the public so I propose that allergy sufferers carry a card with them, provided by the NHS to state that they have a serious allergy and can be administered with an EpiPen.

attributes.action: Let's get Thornton back on track - Reinstatement of the rail link.
attributes.background: The rail link from Poulton Le Fylde to Fleetwood via Thornton closed to to passengers in 1970 and to freight in 1999. The effect on our transport infrastructure and on jobs has been devastating.
attributes.additional_details:
Why do we want this?
1. To better connect Thornton Cleveleys to Poulton and Fleetwood (via rail and / or tram)
2. To battle the traffic congestion on our roads
3. To bring greater employment opportunities and economic prosperity to the area

attributes.action: Force rail companies to freeze rail fares for at least 5 years.
attributes.background: The new rise in rail fares is criminal and only lining the pockets of the wealthy running the trains in Britain. We demand that the rail fares be frozen so that people are not being stripped of their cash and being made poorer just to get to work.

attributes.action: Reform GDPR/Data Law with Automatic Fines on Bodies/Organisations not Complying
attributes.background: Since the GDPR was updated in May 2018 some public bodies/organisations still do not comply. Reform GDPR/Data Law to impose Automatic Daily Fines for failure to respond/comply with a data request within 1 month. If any records are withhold an automatic fine of the ICO maximum of £500,000 must apply
attributes.additional_details: If public bodies/organisations wish to recover some of the costs of the fines they will have to appeal to court to prove which information is being withheld/concealed from individuals & why, how the information was gathered & generated or records contaminated. If proven there is an attempt to obstruct justice those involved should be ordered to pay towards the fine/costs. We must have accountability across our public services, every individual in the UK is entitled to access to all their records

attributes.action: Make it non-compulsory for students to pay for a tv license
attributes.background: If students can prove that a tv license has been paid for at their home address there should be no need to pay for a license at their student accommodation.
attributes.additional_details: Currently students do not have to pay council tax at student accommodation, this should also apply for tv license.

attributes.action: Make payment from net income for residential care tax deductible for over 70's
attributes.background: The cost of residential and social care is extremely high. My Mother is 90 years old and has been in a residential home for three years. Her total income does not fully meet her monthly care charges. To alleviate the problem introduce a tax concession on bona fide care costs for those who pay.
attributes.additional_details: It would be a positive gesture from Government to recognise those who have made honest declarations and are subsequently burdened further by the tax system. The Government should also recognise that payments on account for current tax years are also onerous on meeting care costs and should be addressed. The Government should recognise that most people over the age of 70 are not on PAYE and the tax coding system is unreasonable for that population when in care.

attributes.action: SELECTIVE licensing for tenants should be removed or applied for all landlords.
attributes.background:
SELECTIVE licensing for certain areas and certain landlords is unfair.

The law should be same for all where ever you live in the country.

This should also be applied to letting agencies and housing estates.
attributes.additional_details:
Lisence is applied when you commence a business and require authority of the council this should be same for everyone not selective.

Also the law should be applied to council areas not privately owned.

Safety of tenants can also be address in many other ways.

We are all equal in England and the law should be passed for all not few.

attributes.action: Require differential off-peak electricity rates.
attributes.background: The energy companies have eroded the differential between the night time and day time electricity tariffs, originally introduced to provide competition to other providers of energy, such as oil and gas.
attributes.additional_details: The recent hikes in off-peak rates for electricity have made heating homes for users of storage heaters, in particular, very difficult. Many people, often pensioners, invested in this form of central heating years ago and would find a change to oil (or gas if available) central heating prohibitive.

attributes.action: Raise the minimum wage for those working between 9pm and 7am to £14 p/h
attributes.background: Workers of late shifts—which have been proven to have detrimental effects on health—are increasingly common, and these workers are being exploited.
attributes.additional_details:
Tesco—who made a £1·6bl profit last quarter—pay staff near minimum wage to work until midnight. Clubs hire 18–21-year-olds at £5.60/h till 5.The real living wage in the U.K. is nearly £10/h: https://bbc.in/2JGrY0b This work is unhealthy and those employed deserve compensation.

Study noting an increase in the risk of an early death amongst night-shift workers: https://www.theguardian.com/sustainable-business/2015/oct/28/night-shift-three-million-workers-health-risks-obesity-cancer-diabetes

Radio 4 on damage to organs and the brain caused by nightwork: https://www.ajpmonline.org/article/S0749-3797(14)00623-0/fulltext

https://www.psych.ox.ac.uk/news/how-can-working-night-shifts-affect-mental-and-physical-health

attributes.action: UK to sign the United Nations Convention on Migrants’ Rights
attributes.background:
The International Convention on the Protection of the Rights
of All Migrant Workers and Members of Their Families is a United Nations multilateral treaty governing the protection of migrant workers and families. It has still not been signed by the UK despite being adopted by General Assembly 1990.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.ohchr.org/en/professionalinterest/pages/cmw.aspx

attributes.action: More Money For Unemployed
attributes.background: Unemployed People Like Myself Struggle To Put Food On The Table. Afford Gas And Electric And Rent Top Ups. We Should Get Additional Support From DWP

attributes.action: Widen the A21
attributes.background:
East Sussex only has 11 miles of dual carriageway in the whole county this puts off investors and home buyers to the county as all the roads are slow and congested 
The A21 was planned to be duelled but was scrapped in the 2010 spending review 
The A21 is voted Britain’s most dangerous road
attributes.additional_details:
Widening of the A21 is required from kiplings cross Tunbridge Wells to Hastings 
Lives can be saved and journey times imporoved massively! 
This will give Hastings and East Sussex the infristruture is so desperately needs! 
As a county we have no motorways and pretty much no duel carriageways this causes stress and frustration it’s 2018 it’s about time the government do something to help East Sussex being as the neighboring county of Kent has 3 motorways and plenty of duel caraigeways
